page.title: 02Kington :Major employment
page.content: In Kington and it's surroundings the employment is quite good. A lot of school children of 14 and upwards have Saturday jobs. Quite a lot of the young do paper rounds. Older people work in eg Walters Trouser, Hegotron Printed Circuits Ltd and the laundry. A lot of people get jobs to look after children while the childrens' parents go out to work. The most difficult work to obtain is in agriculture and construction and there are few jobs for professional people. There is plenty of seasonal work eg fruit picking, shearing, potato picking, apple picking. Unemployment is quite low. If you are unemployed you have to go and sign on in Leominster, so people have to travel by bus to sign on. Payment for the jobs is below the national average but is going up all the time.
